Key Match Events: Jimmy Butler returned to the Miami Heat after a five-game absence and contributed to the 119-108 win over the Pelicans.
Despite off-the-court distractions, Butler's performance against the Pelicans included nine points on just five shots.
Pre-Game Insights: Heat coach Erik Spoelstra remained confident that Butler would give Miami a boost before the game against the Pelicans.
The team maintained its intense walkthroughs upon returning from its three-game road trip.
Post-Match Reflections: The Heat's focus remains on the court to maximize hopes of a sixth consecutive playoff appearance.
Butler's presence is still productive enough to swing the Heat’s net rating by 7.6 points.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Butler's scoring average is down to 18.5 points per game, but he has a career-high 55.2 percent shooting.
Defensively, Butler remains among Miami’s leaders in loose balls recovered and deflections.
